alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:43PM CDT until June 18 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FOR WESTERN ELK...EASTERN MCPHERSON...COWLEY...EASTERN SEDGWICK... HARVEY...WESTERN CHASE...BUTLER...MARION...EASTERN SUMNER... CHAUTAUQUA AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 1143 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Marion to near Leon to 6 miles southwest of Cedar Vale, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Newton, El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Wellington, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Hesston, Maize, Hillsboro, Clearwater and Marion. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
